title: TypeError: Cannot read property 'map' of undefined
description: This error occurs when you attempt to iterate over a variable that is supposed to be an array but is instead undefined.
content: In JavaScript, the .map() function is a method of the Array prototype. If you call it on a variable that has not been initialized, or a variable that was expected to be returned as an array (e.g., from an API call) but resulted in undefined, the engine throws this TypeError.
author: Sarah Drasner

title: IndentationError: unexpected indent
description: Python relies on indentation to define scope. Mismatched spaces or tabs will raise this error.
content: Unlike many C-style languages that use braces {}, Python uses whitespace to delimit blocks of code. Mixing tabs and spaces is the most common cause of this error.
code:
# Bad (Mixing tabs and spaces)
def greet():
  print('Hello')
	print('World')

# Good (Consistent 4 spaces)
def greet():
    print('Hello')
    print('World')
author: Guido van Rossum
